p: Local transmission of the Asian lineage was detected in Brazil for the first time in September 2014 in Oiapoque municipality, in the northern region [ 15]. Seven days later, a new cluster of CHIKV infections was notified in the city of Feira de Santana, Bahia state, north-eastern Brazil [ 15]. Sequencing of three isolates revealed those infections in Bahia were caused by the ECSA lineage, signalling its emergence and establishment in the country [ 15]. Since then, the ECSA genotype has been detected in several other Brazilian states in the north-eastern, south-eastern and northern regions, exerting a serious threat to public health, especially because the ECSA lineage is associated with higher symptomatic to asymptomatic ratio compared with the Asian lineage circulating in the Caribbean [ 16â€“ 21].
